intro: Maesa canarana, commonly known as the Canary Islands maesa, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with woody stems and small, leathery leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, clustered in inflorescences, and bloom in spring. Maesa canarana is adapted to the arid and rocky conditions of its native habitat.
